What is the purpose of the `definecurrency` command in Verus, and what are some of its key parameters?

The `definecurrency` command is used to define a new currency or blockchain in Verus. Some of its key parameters include:

* `name`: the name of the new currency or blockchain
* `options`: an integer value that configures various properties of the currency or blockchain
* `currencies`: a list of currencies that can be converted to the new currency
* `preallocations`: an array of allocations of the new currency to specific addresses
* `conversions`: a list of conversion ratios between the new currency and other currencies
* `eras`: an array of block reward, decay, halving, and era end settings for the blockchain
* `blocktime`: the time (in seconds) between blocks on the blockchain
* `idregistrationfees`: the fee for registering an ID on the blockchain
* `notaries`: a list of notary addresses that will validate transactions on the blockchain
* `startblock`: the block number at which the new blockchain will start
* `minnotariesconfirm`: the minimum number of notaries required to confirm a block
* `nodes`: an array of node addresses and identities on the blockchain
* `gatewayconvertername` and `gatewayconverterissuance`: settings for the bridge converter that allows funds to be moved on and off the blockchain
